posts.title: Storage wrapper for JS
posts.description:
I hate cookies. So much. Nearly as much as browsers that don't support new technologies xD

I wrote this wrapper as part of my latest project, and felt that other people could find a use, so I'm releasing it here.

It allows you to set, get and remove data and check whether data is stored. Pretty simple to use, too, unlike cookies.

You can do whatever you want with it, have fun!
posts.formatted_content:
var storage = {}; if (window.localStorage) { storage.get = function(name) { if (window.localStorage[name] === undefined) { return undefined; } return JSON.parse(window.localStorage[name]); }

storage.set = function(name, data)
{
    window.localStorage[name] = JSON.stringify(data);
}

storage.rem = function(name)
{
    delete window.localStorage[name];
}

storage.is = function(name)
{
    return !(window.localStorage[name] === undefined);
}
Raw

} else { storage.get = function(name) { var i, cookies, cookie name = name + '='; cookies = document.cookie.split(';'); for (i = 0; i < cookies.length; i++) { while (cookies[i].slice(0, 1) === ' ') { cookies[i] = cookies[i].slice(1); } if (cookies[i].indexOf(name) === 0) { return JSON.parse(cookies[i].slice(name.length)); } } return undefined; }

storage.set = function(name, data)
{
    var date = new Date();
    date.setTime(date.getTime() + 2592000000);
    var expires = '; expires=' + date.toGMTString();

    data = JSON.stringify(data);

    document.cookie = name + '=' + data + expires + '; path=/';
}

storage.rem = function(name)
{
    var date = new Date();
    date.setTime(date.getTime() - 1);
    var expires = date.toGMTString();

    document.cookie = name + '= ; expires=' + expires + '; path=/';
}

storage.is = function(name)
{
    return !(storage.get(name) === undefined);
}
Raw

}

I hate cookies. So much. Nearly as much as browsers that don't support new technologies xD

I wrote this wrapper as part of my latest project, and felt that other people could find a use, so I'm releasing it here.

posts.title: Display a maintenance page during a site upgrade using .htaccess
posts.content:
# Make sure mod_rewrite is enabled
RewriteEngine on
 
# Show maintenance page to visitors
RewriteCond %{REMOTE_ADDR} !^111\.111\.111\.111
RewriteCond %{REQUEST_URI} !/maintenance.html$
RewriteRule $ /maintenance.html [R=503,L]
posts.description:
Simple mod_rewrite rule to redirect all visitors except for hosts you have specified to a maintenance page when performing a site upgrade. Obviously will only work with Apache.

Just drop the code into your .htacess file and change the false IP address to match the host you wish to whitelist. If you need to provide access to multiple hosts, just duplicate the line containing the IP as required.

**Addendum 03/06/2011:** Updated the code to redirect using a 503 header as per [wturrell's](http://forrst.com/people/wturrell) advice. See the following page: [503 service temporarily unavailable](http://www.askapache.com/htaccess/503-service-temporarily-unavailable.html)

posts.title: Fit text (headings) on one line - first cut.
posts.description:
### When you have a heading that is of variable length and you want it to fit on one line.

    $("# selector ").fitText2();
    $("# selector ").fitText2( ratio_divider: 0.565 );

**Font size calculation:** ( width_of_container / character_length ) / ratio_divider = font-size that fits in that width

[Demo]: http://harrison.github.com/fontFit.js/ 
[Demo][]

*Discalimer:* Liked the general idea of paravelinc's Fittext.js - however it didn't work in my use case so here goes. Untested and unproven.

© WTFPL@ lal.com // philip harrison
posts.formatted_content:
;(function( $ ){ $.fn.fitText2 = function( ratio ) {

  return this.each(function(){
    var $this = $(this);                                     // store the object
    var origFontSize = parseFloat($this.css('font-size'));   // init the font sizes
    var ratio = ratio || 0.565;                              // set the ratio (this works for helvetica neue bold)
    var len = $this.text().length;                           // get the number of chars
    var width = $this.width();                               // get the width
    var newFontSize;

    function resizer(newSize) {
      $this.css({ 'font-size' : newSize });
    }

    if ((origFontSize * ratio) * len >= width ) {
      newFontSize = parseInt(( width / len ) / ratio);
      resizer(newFontSize);
    }

  });
Raw

}; })( jQuery );
